meanings.definition: A short, high-pitched sound or tone.
meanings.sent1: The microwave made a loud bleep when it finished heating.
meanings.sent2: I heard a bleep coming from the alarm clock in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The bleep of the oven timer startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The bleep of the digital watch marked the passing seconds.
meanings.sent5: The bleep of the car horn echoed through the quiet street.

meanings.definition: To censor or obscure offensive language in broadcasting.
meanings.sent1: The TV station had to bleep out the inappropriate words from the live show.
meanings.sent2: They decided to bleep the curse words from the radio broadcast.
meanings.sent3: The editor had to bleep the swear words from the documentary before airing it.
meanings.sent4: The software automatically bleeps any profanity in the video.
meanings.sent5: The radio host had to quickly bleep the caller's offensive language.

meanings.definition: An expletive used to replace a swear word.
meanings.sent1: When he stubbed his toe, he let out a loud bleep of frustration.
meanings.sent3: Bleep! I forgot my keys at home.
meanings.sent4: She let out a bleep of surprise when she saw the mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: Bleep! I can't believe I missed the bus again.
